DataElement.preferredName: DNA Copy Number Programming Parameter Segment Smoothing Method java.lang.Double
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.:The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.:A value that is passed to a routine._One of the parts into which something naturally divides.:The modification of a set of data to make it smooth and nearly continuous and remove or diminish outlying points.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._Generic value domain for a primitive java datatype that is a Double-precision floating point number (64-bit IEEE 7540).

Concepts.definition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.
The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.
A value that is passed to a routine.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of the parts into which something naturally divides.:The modification of a set of data to make it smooth and nearly continuous and remove or diminish outlying points.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: One of the parts into which something naturally divides.
The process by which a data set is simplified to reduce irregularities.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
